Description: Band (7x25.5 cm) of tapestry applied and sewn to an open plain weave of undyed wool; the decoration is organised in three parts; the central part shows, on a red background, a stylised female with large eyes, dark hair and wearing a diadem or crown, with an ornamented dress, her arms are held up and she holds the same stylised object in each hand (palm leaf?), depicted like this her arms look like wings ; above her shoulders are two beige crosses and on each side of her body are two stylised human heads; the two other parts of the decoration, on the right and left of the above, are occupied by two freizes of vegetal motifs and leaves on a dark blue background, separated by a freize of beige dots on a red background; the entire band is framed, above and below, by two freizes of yellow, geometric motifs on a dark blue background; plain weave: warp-undyed wool (S/11), weft-undyed wool (S/9); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/11), weft-undyed linen (S/56), yellow, red,dark blue wool (S/red is 72); oversewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply); all edges of the plain weave are ragged; two simple selvedges of the tapestry are preserved and two are hemmed
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
